location: 1 Yarmouth Rd., Unit C, Waterloo, ON, N2J 2H6, CAN
key_elements: Storage Racks, Sorting Area, Hangers Area
overall_building_description: The racking layout for the Schenker TJX project is meticulously designed to optimize storage capacity and operational efficiency within the industrial facility. The plan, specifically focusing on Row X, incorporates a strategic arrangement of storage racks, hangers area, and sorting area, ensuring seamless workflow and accessibility. The layout accommodates 310 pallet locations, indicating a high-density storage solution tailored to meet the demands of industrial logistics. The dimension '15'-3"' between certain elements suggests precise spacing to facilitate maneuverability and safety within the storage environment. The overall dimension of '123'-9"' for Row X underscores the expansive nature of the storage system, designed to maximize the use of available floor space. The integration of braced frames within the lateral system provides essential stability against lateral loads, ensuring structural integrity under operational conditions. The absence of explicit concrete strengths, steel shapes, and rebar sizes in the documentation suggests a focus on modular racking systems, likely pre-engineered to meet specific load requirements. The design by Waddell Engineering Ltd., dated January 30, 2025, reflects a comprehensive approach to industrial storage solutions, emphasizing efficiency, safety, and adaptability. The use of precise engineering terminology and adherence to design standards is evident throughout the documentation, highlighting the technical expertise involved in the project. The spatial arrangement within the ground floor plan facilitates effective load transfer and distribution, critical for maintaining the structural performance of the racking system. The project's focus on maximizing storage density while ensuring operational safety aligns with industry best practices, demonstrating a commitment to delivering high-quality engineering solutions tailored to client needs. The meticulous planning and execution of the racking layout underscore the importance of detailed engineering analysis in achieving optimal functionality and performance in industrial storage applications.
